audience_overview.one_sentence_summary: Privately-owned small manufacturing firms in North America producing custom or niche industrial, consumer, or component goods, led by hands-on owners seeking modernization and growth.
audience_overview.primary_identity: Small manufacturing company (5–20 years in business, $3M–$25M revenue)
locations: Midwest & Rust Belt (OH, MI, WI, IL, IN)

core_desires: Win more B2B contracts and expand distribution
Improve cash-flow predictability and profit margins
Modernize tech stack (automation, ERP, AI analytics) without disrupting output
Build a more skilled and reliable workforce
fears_risks_anxieties: Downtime from new-system adoption hurting delivery schedules
Rising labor and raw-material costs eroding margins
Losing contracts to cheaper overseas competitors
Compliance, quality, or safety failures damaging reputation
Choosing the wrong technology partner and wasting capital
key_values: Clear ROI with measurable efficiency gains
Industry-savvy partners who understand shop-floor realities
emotional_motivators: Desire to protect jobs for their community and employees
Relief from daily firefighting and production stress
Competitive drive to prove a small shop can beat larger rivals

major_problems: Inefficient production scheduling and excess downtime
Legacy equipment & disconnected software causing data silos
Inventory mismanagement leading to cash tied-up or shortages
Low visibility into real-time costs and profitability
failed_solutions: Off-the-shelf ERP or MRP modules that were too generic or poorly implemented
Manual spreadsheets patched together across departments
Outsourced marketing/sales without clear ICP targeting
One-off automation projects that didn’t integrate with the rest of the plant
day_to_day_manifestations: Constant rescheduling, overtime, and rush-shipping fees
Paper travelers or whiteboards still driving production priorities
“Tribal knowledge” locked in a few veteran employees
Leadership spending time firefighting rather than pursuing new business

desired_transformation.ideal_future_state: A lean, tech-enabled operation with predictable output, >95% on-time delivery, lower scrap and overtime, transparent cost data, and a sales pipeline that fuels steady growth.
desired_transformation.self_description_after_success: We finally run like a modern manufacturer — efficient, data-driven, competitive, and attractive to new customers and talent.

limiting_beliefs: We’re too small to afford the right technology
Automation will be disruptive or put my people out of work
Big-company solutions won’t fit a 50-person shop
bad_advice_myths: A single ERP will fix everything
Lean or AI is only for Fortune-500 plants
Cheaper overseas sourcing always beats local modernization
buying_triggers: Losing a major contract due to missed delivery/quality metrics
A new compliance or ISO-certification requirement
Capacity crunch from sudden demand surge

customer_phrases: Our machines aren’t talking to each other
We need better visibility on our margins
Hard to find skilled machinists who’ll stay
